A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: You're left with Adam Driver's petulant temper tantrums leading a galaxy wide empire that had trouble killing a couple of henchmen guards early in the movie.  Rey\, who can now move rocks\, Luke disappeared for no reason after his main purpose was to be a distraction after 30 years of exile\, God only knows what the Leia's wicked witch of the west scene was about\, Snoke got so caught up in a hate orgasm that he did not sense his own demise\, the rebels biggest issue was not having a gas station around\, Finn went to a casino\, rode a floppy eared donkey so that he could kiss an asian woman\, and a kid at the end uses the force to sweep crap off of a freighter.  That is the story\, that is what you are left with\, a bunch of who cares what happens next.  Pretty sad when you can make phantom menace look like an award winner
